unnormalised: ## Automotive News: Traffic Woes & New Rules, Eh?
normalised: ## Automotive News: Traffic Woes and New Rules, Eh?

unnormalised: Bangalore traffic, yaar! You know the drill. But heads up, folks, new traffic regulations are rolling out faster than your scooter after a filter coffee.
normalised: Bangalore traffic, yaar! You know the drill. But heads up, folks, new traffic regulations are rolling out faster than your scooter after a filter coffee.

unnormalised: First up, heavier fines for signal jumping – think Rs. 5000 now, not chump change! They're even cracking down on fancy number plates that look more like artwork than registration. Apparently, fancy fonts and hidden numbers are a big no-no.
normalised: First up, heavier fines for signal jumping – think rupees five thousand now, not chump change! They're even cracking down on fancy number plates that look more like artwork than registration. Apparently, fancy fonts and hidden numbers are a big no-no.

unnormalised: And for all you delivery guys zipping around on bikes for that urgent biryani order, make sure your vehicle registration is completely up-to-date, or face challans.
normalised: And for all you delivery guys zipping around on bikes for that urgent biryani order, make sure your vehicle registration is completely up-to-date, or face challans.

unnormalised: The Bengaluru Traffic Police are saying it's all about reducing accidents and improving flow, especially with Onam just around the corner and everyone heading back home.
normalised: The Bengaluru Traffic Police are saying it's all about reducing accidents and improving flow, especially with Onam just around the corner and everyone heading back home.

unnormalised: They're also testing some AI-powered cameras at major junctions like MG Road and Koramangala. These things are supposed to automatically detect violations. No escape, macha!
normalised: They're also testing some A I-powered cameras at major junctions like M G Road and Koramangala. These things are supposed to automatically detect violations. No escape, macha!

unnormalised: The transport ministry also announced new speed limits on the Outer Ring Road – max 60 kmph for cars and even lower for heavier vehicles.
normalised: The transport ministry also announced new speed limits on the Outer Ring Road – maximum sixty kilometer per hour for cars and even lower for heavier vehicles.

unnormalised: So, buckle up (literally!), and brush up on those rules. Drive safe, and maybe leave extra time to get to that Onam Sadhya on time!
normalised: So, buckle up (literally!), and brush up on those rules. Drive safe, and maybe leave extra time to get to that Onam Sadhya on time!
